definition: toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: Look for no profit out of it, see no future in it, just the present.
sentences.chinese: 不要鑽營於利益之中，沒有未來的考量，只有現在。

sentences.english: He bribed himself onto the committee.
sentences.chinese: 他暗通關節，鑽營投機擠進了委員會。

sentences.english: China's development will not bring harm or pose a threat to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 中國鑽營發展既不破損他人，更不恐嚇他人。

sentences.english: We hate our peers because they always seem to get ahead of us.
sentences.chinese: 我們痛恨同業，因爲他們永遠比我們會鑽營。

definition: to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
